attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In 04/06 the gov't upped fees for non EU spouses of British born people to obtain ILR. 

I ret'd home with my South African husband in '05.Before leaving we pd for his Visa,& prepared to meet the req's for his ILR after 24 mnths-Prove that he had worked,supp'd his family/pd taxes/bills/not broken laws/no recourse to public funds/£175+  

Hubby has met these req's.The burden of this hike in fees to keep my fam. together has been a blow & have been applied to entry visas iss'd prior to law change.

We get by,but live in a low income area. I now have to find £750 out of my budget. Failure means breach of immig law,& my husband will be ref'd the right to remain.

This is unfair on Brits who just want to resettle & build a family life.
It is now easier for EU citizens & their fam's to settle in the UK than is for me. 

Ret. nat's should not be targeted. We have got it tough, & often ret. from countries where the curr. is weak. We do not exp't help, but should not be hindered.

Hubby is no drain on pub. spend. Why target us with these fees & put families like mine under fear of separation?

Make it about building a strong society, & not abt money. Lobby the gov't to lower fees for long term Spouses to obtain ILR
